title: Research Assistant Intern Interview
Interview Descriptions: Asked a few questions about bakground, motivation and future plan. The porfessors really cared about the fit of the candidates. Overall a very friendly inerview. There is no technical questions.
Interview Questions: What is your plan for the future

title: Data Specialist Interview
Interview Descriptions: It was bit formal, mostly about past experiences and how it is relevant to role proposed. Also process is bit genuine, interviewer were very nice and didn't make the interview very stressful

title: MBA Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at INSEAD in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview was relatively easy and straightforward. However waiting process was very long about one month. Made me go for 2 interviews and in the end they offered the role to someone else. Wasted plenty of my time. Future job seeker please do not render your resignation before getting an offer here
Interview Questions: Are you alright with a desk bound job?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at INSEAD (Singapore) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions:
Hiring process was ok, Hr, f2f and had a test but didnt get to pass to the team meeting round? 

Job requirements seems too heavy compared to salary offered for the role. Other than that, interview process was generally normal except that test seemed to be last minute/ not with proper setting eg. Time limit n etc, which they did give were an unreasonable time for the clean up they were expecting. 

No follow up after feedback and test sent. Feel that standards for the masters school, interview process can be better.

title: Project Manager Interview
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and efficient. 2 rounds only and very accessible HR personnel. Managers are super nice and the HR responds quickly to all questions we have. Manager interviews are straightforward. No assignments or projects pre-interview. Results given to you within a week.
Interview Questions: Past experiences in the field? Worked for any schools before? Project management apps used?

title: Assistant Director, Career Development Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at INSEAD (Singapore)
Interview Descriptions: 2 - 3 rounds of interview, mostly behaviour. In some team, you may be required to work on a presentation and present it to the group. There will be group evaluation afterward.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the Education sector? What do you think the challenges would be in this role?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at INSEAD (Singapore) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and receive a reply from HR within a week. 
Was scheduled for a virtual interview with the hiring manager the following week. Interview was pretty easy if you have the relevant experience that they are looking for in coordination. Receive an offer on the same day of interview.
Interview Questions: Share with us some of your experience in your current job

title: MBA Class Officer (Asia Campus) Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at INSEAD (Singapore) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
1st Interview with Singapore Academic Manager (reporting officer for MBA Class officer).  (About an hour long as I asked several questions and the interviewer also asked couple of questions, shared alot about the job responsibilites and asked situational questions).

1 week+ later I was contacted for a 2nd Interview with France Academic Director and Academic Manager. Entire interview about 30 mins, friendly and pleasant interview. Mostly share about the INSEAD and the programmes.

3rd: Singapore Academic Manager requested for a informal face-to-face chat at INSEAD Asia one-north campus over coffee. Asked me some questions from the 1st Interview and showed me around the campus.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and share with me/us of your experiences in your current job and what you have been doing?

title: Sales Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at INSEAD
Interview Descriptions: Very exhausting. I felt drained after the interview. Now I understand what energy vampire means. The hiring manager and their hr didn't even offered me water for 2hr interview.
Interview Questions: Asked me why I wasn't agree to wear a red lipstick to make more sales at my previous job

title: Ra Interview
Interview Descriptions: Walked through the CV and past projects. Interviewers were very nice and patient. It took around 30 minutes. There is only one round but waited for a long time to get the final results.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at INSEAD (Singapore) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to review a recent research paper. Then there were two rounds of interviews conducted by two faculty members in my department. The interview was done in distance via skype. Each lasts around 30-60 minutes.
Interview Questions: I was asked to review a research paper published in a top journal and give comments. The paper was assigned to me a couple of days before the interview.

title: Assistant Director of Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at INSEAD
Interview Descriptions:
applied for the job online, heard back from their HR department very quickly.  4 rounds of interviews - all behaviourial interviews.  Final round with HR, turnaround time from start to finish was about 6 - 8 weeks.
they were very prompt with all my questions, didn't have really long to wait in between interviews and they were always transparent during the entire process
